reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great alternative to the big chain hotels nearby. Location is great, just off tottenham court road, a five minute walk to all of the new restaurants just to the west of tottenham ct rd.
reviews.title: Nice little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was small, but comfortable and clean with nice bathroom, LCD TV, small working area with broadband. No aircon however.
reviews.title: Friendly Staff, Tiny, Clean Rooms

reviews.text: Lacks a bar, but plenty of bars and pubs nearby that are open into the very early hours. Reception was manned 24 hours so no problems when we crawled back in at 2am!
reviews.title: Friendly hotel, and great location

reviews.text: Better than your average London 3*, but on a much smaller scale.
reviews.title: Hotel from Hell

reviews.text: I have rated this hotel 4 because of the value for money aspect not because it's a great hotel, though to be fair it's not that bad either. I paid just £60 for a twin room including breakfast but wouldn't be happy paying full rate to stay at Country Inn.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location!

reviews.text: The location can't be beat for my needs (a night out), it's a 2 minute stroll from Tottenham Court Rd Tube. Obviously being so central it is noisy outside at all hours and the rooms are only single glazed. No problem for me as a few glasses of vino and i'll sleep through anything!
reviews.title: 3* Hotel?? Not by a long shot! The Good, The bad and The Unbelievable

reviews.text: The room was spotlessly clean and i was pleasantly surprised at the standard after reading some previous reviews. The only negative of the room was the ridiculously small bathroom - seriously it's the smallest i've ever seen! It wasn't a major problem though as i didn't plan on spending too much time in there.
reviews.title: Don't look uner the covers!

likes.liked: — location is pretty good, quiet but near plenty of shops and restaurants

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only one thing about the hotel was terrible and that's breakfast. No buffet table at all and the one 'waitress' is v busy so if you don't want to wait forever and a day even to get a glass of juice you have to catch her while she's at the counter and order. If you want another glass of juice, etc again catch her while you can! There's a choice of continental or cooked but you can't have both so i had the vegetarian breakfast, it arrived and comprised of 2 eggs, 1 tomato and 3 mushrooms - hardly substantial.
reviews.title: Didnt even get a room!

reviews.text: For my needs at that price the hotel overall was ok, i would stay again at £60 per night but wouldn't bother getting out of bed for breakfast!
reviews.title: Please don't go there

reviews.text: My favourite hotels were fully booked at the time of my travel, so I chose this hotel because of its excellent location.
reviews.title: Claustrophobia guaranteed

likes.disliked: — smallest room ever, no view from the window

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Based on the price paid (~100 GBP/night) I would have expected much more. I got the smallest room I've ever seen. It was more like a matchbox. Strange that the bathroom was quite spacious.
reviews.title: OMG! Don't even think about it. Never book here. Ever!!!!!!

likes.liked: — The Location was great within easy 2 minute walk to the closest tube.

reviews.text: Try to avoid the 4th floor, as there is a molding in front of the window, which takes the whole view.
reviews.title: this could be a very nice hotel...

reviews.text: Apart from its size, the room was very well equipped: TV, telephone, tea and coffee making facilities, hairdryer, iron, excellent (free) internet connection (own laptop, or TV & keyboard).
reviews.title: Loved Country Inn & Suites

likes.liked: — Location, Cleanliness, Price, Friendliness of satff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception staff are friendly, but not too professional. I was very surprised that the whole price was requested in advance. Later I realized that the cause might have been the possibility to leave the hotel through an unattended back-door.
reviews.title: bring earplugs!

likes.liked: — The poor guy doing his best to serve breakfast and clear the tables on his own.
